title: WPD teams up with local authorities for EPIC project
lead: ​Western Power Distribution is to explore the benefits of collaboration between local authorities and network companies through its new Energy Planning Integrated with Councils (EPIC) project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Modo makes new chief product officer hire as it focuses on product-first approach
lead: ​Energy data start-up Modo has appointed Nima Tabatabai as chief product officer following stints at Kiwi Power and Piclo.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SaaS provider Innowatts opens Irish office as it continues expansion into Europe
lead: Energy software-as-a-service (SaaS) provider Innowatts is expanding its European presence, with a new office set to open in Cork, Ireland.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem launches consultation into half-hourly settlement
lead: ​Ofgem has launched a consultation into the implementation and governance arrangements of the introduction of half-hourly settlement.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Iduna raises £4m for EV charging in Manchester in just six days
lead: ​Car charging scheme Iduna has attracted over £4 million in investment in just six days.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Vattenfall eyes offering energy infrastructure for electric trucks in Tevva MoU
lead: ​Vattenfall Network Solutions has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with UK-based electric truck firm Tevva to support fleet electrification.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Statkraft-owned Mer launches into UK EV charging market
lead: ​Mer has announced its launch into the UK’s electric vehicle (EV) charging market, targeting underserved areas of the country.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ahead of election ENA sets out key priorities to meet ‘high bar’ set by previous Scottish governments
lead: ​The Energy Networks Association (ENA) has laid out its five key priorities ahead of the Scottish election.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ​Current± Chats: InstaVolt's Adrian Keen on developing rapid charging motorway hubs
lead: ​Current± caught up with InstaVolt’s chief executive officer, Adrian Keen to chat about bringing rapid charging to motorways "with a twist" and the importance of partnering with well-known brands.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Less than a sixth of initial Green Homes Grant target to be met, new data reveals
lead: ​The latest Green Homes Grant statistics to come from the government show that less than a sixth of the initial projected 600,000 homes will receive vouchers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Solar and wind could entirely displace fossil fuels by 2050 says Carbon Tracker
lead: ​In less than a decade, solar power will be economic in comparison to local fossil fuels globally, while wind will be economic in more than half of cases.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: 800 JustPark residential EV chargers to be added into Zap-Home network
lead: ​Parking platform JustPark is to make over 800 electric vehicle (EV) chargers available on the Zap-Map platform from June 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ohme to provide smart EV charging for Octopus salary sacrifice scheme
lead: Ohme has partnered with Octopus Electric Vehicles to provide smart charging technology for its Electric Dreams salary sacrifice scheme.
author: Alice Grundy

title: More data is still needed to develop on-street charging that works for everyone
lead: Experts on the Looking at the Latest Technologies and Solutions to Supply On-Street Charging panel at the Everything EV Summit discussed the need for more information about people's habits and concerns as councils and companies look to rollout on-street charging.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: New opportunities for smaller scale generators to provide electricity balancing services
lead: Elexon's Victoria Moxham takes a look at the P375 modification and how it will open up the Balancing Mechanism.
author: Victoria Moxham

title: Battery storage the key to easing EV grid upgrade concerns, unlocking other benefits
lead: Integrating battery energy storage solutions alongside electric vehicle charging hubs can pose a multitude of benefits to charging operators, while also unlocking benefits for fleet owners.
author: Liam Stoker

title: EAC slams government for 'simply abandoning' Green Homes Grant
lead: ​The Environmental Audit Committee (EAC) has warned that "actions speak louder than words" following the early closure of the Green Homes Grant.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Green jobs could replace those lost due to COVID-19 in two years claims report
lead: ​Investment in green jobs could allow them to replace all those lost due to the COVID-19 pandemic in two years, according to research from Green New Deal UK.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: IEA: Global power demand to jump 4.5% as renewables remain ‘largely immune’ to COVID-19 impacts
lead: ​Global demand for electricity is predicted to rise by 4.5% in 2021 – equivalent to 1,000TWh – following heavy reductions as a result of COVID-19.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ofgem gives green light to half-hourly settlement in retail electricity market
lead: ​Ofgem has given the green light to rolling out half-hourly settlement across the retail electricity market in Britain.
author: Molly Lempriere
